Steam (ST): Every year, the relatives visiting Rokkenjima would let out a sigh of admiration at the rose garden that first greeted them...
Umineko Project (UP): Every year, the relatives who visit Rokkenjima let out a sigh of admiration at the rose garden which first greets them...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Every year, the relatives who visit Rokkenjima let out a sigh of admiration at the rose garden which first greets them...
PC Japanese (JP): 六軒島を訪れる親族たちは、毎年、最初に出迎えられる薔薇庭園で感嘆のため息を漏らすことになる…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 六軒島を訪れる親族たちは、毎年、最初に出迎えられる薔薇庭園で感嘆のため息を漏らすことになる…。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Todo ano, os parentes que visitam Rokkenjima deixam escapar um suspiro de admiração ao se depararem com o jardim de rosas, o qual é o primeiro a dar as boas‐vindas a eles...

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Ogni anno, i parenti che facevano visita a Rokkenjima sospiravano in ammirazione dinanzi al roseto, il quale era la prima cosa ad accoglierli...

Steam (ST): They would stop there to chat about the roses' beauty and how well they were blooming that year.
Umineko Project (UP): They stood there talking with each other about the roses' beauty and the state of their blooming this year.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They stand still, talking with each other about the roses' beauty and the state of their blooming.
PC Japanese (JP): 彼らは足を止め、今年の薔薇の美しさや咲き具合について語り合うのだった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 彼らは足を止め、今年の薔薇の美しさや咲き具合について語り合うのだった。
Russian (RU): Они стояли вместе, обсуждая друг с другом красоту роз и их цветение.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eles sempre param ali, e conversam sobre a beleza das rosas e o estado de seu florescimento.
Vietnamese (VI): They stood there talking with each other about the roses' beauty and the state of their blooming this year.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 今年他們也停下腳步，熱烈談論著美麗的玫瑰與盛開的美景。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 今年他们也停下脚步，热烈谈论着美丽的玫瑰与盛开的美景。
Indonesian (IDN): They stood there talking with each other about the roses' beauty and the state of their blooming this year.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Si fermano, parlando gli uni con gli altri della bellezza delle rose e di come stiano sbocciando.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Essi si fermarono sui loro passi, parlando gli uni con gli altri della bellezza e della fioritura delle rose di quell'anno.
Turkish (TR): Öylece durmuş, birbirleriyle güllerin güzelliği ve bu yılki çiçek açma durumları hakkında konuşuyorlardı.

Steam (ST): In the midst of all this, there was a single unhealthy rose, and Maria became overwhelmed with dejection at its condition.
Umineko Project (UP): There was a single unhealthy rose among them, and Maria became overwhelmed with dejection at its state.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In the midst of all this, there was a single unhealthy rose, and Maria became overwhelmed with dejection at its state.
PC Japanese (JP): その中に一輪、枯れ掛けた薔薇があり、真里亞が感傷に囚われ消沈してしまう。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): その中に一輪、枯れ掛けた薔薇があり、真里亞が感傷に囚われ消沈してしまう。
Russian (RU): На фоне всего этого великолепия одна роза была нездорова, и Мария приуныла, заметив это.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Havia uma única rosa doente entre elas, que chamou a atenção de Maria, deixando‐a deprimida por causa de sua condição.
Vietnamese (VI): There was a single unhealthy rose among them, and Maria became overwhelmed with dejection at its state.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在這之中，有一朵快要枯萎的玫瑰，真里亞為此陷入了感傷，意志消沉了起來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在这之中，有一朵快要枯萎的玫瑰，真里亚为此陷入了感伤，意志消沉了起来。
Indonesian (IDN): There was a single unhealthy rose among them, and Maria became overwhelmed with dejection at its state.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In mezzo a tutto ciò, c'era una singola rosa malaticcia, e per questo Maria si abbatté.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Tra queste era presente una rosa appassita, e Maria fu sopraffatta dallo sconforto per lo stato in cui era.
Turkish (TR): Aralarında sağlıksız bir gül vardı ve Maria onun durumu karşısında üzüntüye boğuldu.

Steam (ST): But George used his quick wits, and, saying that everything would be fine if they took care of this poor thing, marked it with a candy wrapper and immediately restored Maria's good mood.
Umineko Project (UP): But George used his quick wits, and saying she should look after it if she felt that sorry for it, he marked it with a candy wrapper, and immediately restored Maria's good mood.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But George used his quick wits, and, saying everything would be fine if they looked over this poor thing, marked it with a candy wrapper, and immediately restored Maria's good mood.
PC Japanese (JP): でも、譲治が機転を利かし、そんなに可哀想なら面倒を見てあげればいいと飴玉の包み紙で目印を付けてあげると、すぐに機嫌を直した。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): でも、譲治が機転を利かし、そんなに可哀想なら面倒を見てあげればいいと飴玉の包み紙で目印を付けてあげると、すぐに機嫌を直した。
Russian (RU): Но Джордж, используя свою смекалку, сказал, что всё будет в порядке, если мы будем следить за этой розой, отметив её бантиком из обертки конфеты, и к Марии быстро вернулось хорошее настроение.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas George usou sua perspicácia rápida, e dizendo à Maria para cuidar da rosa se estava com pena, ele então marcou a rosa com um embrulho de bala e, imediatamente, restaurou o bom humor de Maria.
Vietnamese (VI): But George used his quick wits, and saying she should look after it if she felt that sorry for it, he marked it with a candy wrapper, and immediately restored Maria's good mood.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，讓治靈機一動，對她講道“既然你這麼可怜它，那就來好好照顧它吧”，並用糖果的包裝紙給它做了個記號，馬上就使真里亞的心情有了好轉。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，让治灵机一动，对她讲道“既然你这么可怜它，那就来好好照顾它吧”，并用糖果的包装纸给它做了个记号，马上就使真里亚的心情有了好转。
Indonesian (IDN): But George used his quick wits, and saying she should look after it if she felt that sorry for it, he marked it with a candy wrapper, and immediately restored Maria's good mood.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ma George usando la sua astuzia, e, dicendo che sarebbe andato tutto bene se l'avessero controllata, la segnò con un incarto di caramella, e immediatamente restituì il buonumore a Maria.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Ma George, usando la sua astuzia, le disse che, se quel fiore la intristiva così tanto, avrebbe dovuto prendersene cura, e lo marcò con un incarto di caramella, restituendole subito il buonumore.
Turkish (TR): Fakat George kıvrak zekasını kullandı, ve eğer bu kadar üzülüyorsa ona göz kulak olması gerektiğini söyleyerek üzerine bir şeker ambalajı geçirdi ve Maria'nın neşesini hemen yerine getirdi.

Steam (ST): Then Battler, with whom she'd been getting along well since that morning, started talking about Halloween.
Umineko Project (UP): And once Battler, with whom she had been getting along well all morning, raised the subject of Halloween that Maria loved so much, she began playing around energetically again.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And once Battler, with whom she had been getting along well since that morning,
PC Japanese (JP): そして、今朝からずっと仲のいい戦人が、真里亞の大好きなハロウィンの話を振ると、もう元気を取り戻しはしゃぎ始めるのだった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): そして、今朝からずっと仲のいい戦人が、真里亞の大好きなハロウィンの話を振ると、もう元気を取り戻しはしゃぎ始めるのだった。
Russian (RU): А когда Баттлер, с которым она хорошо поладила этим утром, вновь заговорил на любимую тему Марии, Хэллоуин, к ней вернулись энергия и задор.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E uma vez que Battler, com quem ela esteve se dando bem toda a manhã, trouxe à tona o assunto de Halloween que Maria tanto amava, e ela começou a brincar energeticamente mais uma vez.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 从今早开始就一直与她很要好的战人，也跟着抛去了她最喜欢的万圣夜的话题，使真里亚又开始活泼地吵闹了起来。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): E una volta che Battler, con cui era andata d'accordo sin da quel mattino, menzionò la festa di Halloween tanto amata da Maria, lei riacquistò subito le energie, e iniziò a sprizzare di gioia.

Steam (ST): This was such a favorite topic of Maria's that she began playing around energetically again. To Maria, that marshmallow jack-o-lantern candy bought by her mother was probably the greatest sort of treasure.
Umineko Project (UP): To Maria, those marshmallow jack‐o'‐lantern candies that her mother had bought for her were probably a treasure greater than any other.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): raised the subject that Maria loved so much, Halloween, she began playing around energetically again. Maria probably treasured that marshmallow jack-o-lantern candy that her mother had bought for her more than anything.
PC Japanese (JP): 真里亞にとっては、今朝、楼座に買ってもらったジャックオーランタンのマシュマロ菓子が何よりの宝物なのだろう。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 真里亞にとっては、今朝、楼座に買ってもらったジャックオーランタンのマシュマロ菓子が何よりの宝物なのだろう。

Vietnamese (VI): To Maria, those marshmallow jack‐o'‐lantern candies that her mother had bought for her were probably a treasure greater than any other.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 對真里亞來說，今天早上樓座給她買的南瓜燈軟糖，應該是勝過了一切的無價之寶吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 对真里亚来说，今天早上楼座给她买的南瓜灯软糖，应该是胜过了一切的无价之宝吧。
Indonesian (IDN): To Maria, those marshmallow jack‐o'‐lantern candies that her mother had bought for her were probably a treasure greater than any other.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Maria probabilmente fece tesoro più di qualsiasi altra cosa di quel marshmallow a forma di jack-o-lantern che sua Madre le aveva comprato.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Per Maria, quei marshmallow a forma di zucca di Halloween che Rosa le aveva comprato in mattinata erano probabilmente il suo più grande tesoro...
Turkish (TR): Maria için, annesinin ona aldığı o jack-o'-lantern şekerleri muhtemelen en kıymetli hazineydi.

Steam (ST): ...They seemed to have bought several, and she demanded a trick-or-treat from every person she met, giving them candy instead of the other way around.
Umineko Project (UP): ...It seemed that several of them had been bought for her, and she demanded trick‐or‐treat from every person she met, giving them candy instead of the other way around.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...It seemed that several of them had been bought for her, and she demanded trick-or-treat from every person she met, giving them candy instead of the other way around.
PC Japanese (JP): …何本も買ってもらったらしく、会う人会う人にトリックオアトリートを求めては、逆にお菓子を与えているのだった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …何本も買ってもらったらしく、会う人会う人にトリックオアトリートを求めては、逆にお菓子を与えているのだった。
Russian (RU): ...Похоже, что ей купили несколько штук, и она требовала сладость или гадость у каждого, кто ей встречался, даря им конфеты, а не наоборот.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Parecia que elas haviam comprados vários, e para todos que ela encontrava, Maria sempre os cumprimentava dizendo {i:trick or treat}, mas no lugar das travessuras, sempre entregava um doce.
Vietnamese (VI): ...It seemed that several of them had been bought for her, and she demanded trick‐or‐treat from every person she met, giving them candy instead of the other way around.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …好像媽媽給她買了好幾根，每遇上個人，她都會去要求一番“不給糖就搗蛋”，然後自己反把糖送人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …好像妈妈给她买了好几根，每遇上个人，她都会去要求一番“不给糖就捣蛋”，然后自己反把糖送人。
Indonesian (IDN): ...It seemed that several of them had been bought for her, and she demanded trick‐or‐treat from every person she met, giving them candy instead of the other way around.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Sembrava che ne avesse comprato molti per lei, e chiedeva dolcetto o scherzetto ad ogni persona che incontrava, dando loro caramelle invece di fare il contrario.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Apparentemente ne erano stati acquistati in gran quantità, e con essi chiedeva dolcetto o scherzetto a chiunque incontrasse, donando dolciumi invece di chiederli.
Turkish (TR): ...Görünüşe göre bunlardan birkaç tane almışlardı ve karşılaştığı her insana şaka mı şeker mi diye sorarak onlara şeker veriyordu.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "I wonder why Maria likes Halloween so much. I always figured it was a pretty unfamiliar event for the Japanese."
Umineko Project (UP): "I wonder why Maria likes Halloween so much. I thought that event was pretty difficult for Japanese people to get used to."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I wonder why Maria likes Halloween so much. I thought that event was pretty difficult for Japanese people to get used to."
PC Japanese (JP): 「真里亞はどうしてこんなにハロウィンが好きなんだろうな。日本人には、ひとつ馴染みにくいイベントだと思ってたんだが。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「真里亞はどうしてこんなにハロウィンが好きなんだろうな。日本人には、ひとつ馴染みにくいイベントだと思ってたんだが」
Russian (RU): "Меня вот удивляет, почему Марии так сильно нравится Хэллоуин. Я думал, что к подобному событию японцам довольно трудно привыкнуть."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Me pergunto o porquê da Maria gostar tanto assim do Halloween. Sempre pensei que esse evento fosse bem difícil para pessoas japonesas se acostumarem."
Vietnamese (VI): "I wonder why Maria likes Halloween so much. I thought that event was pretty difficult for Japanese people to get used to."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「真里亞為什麼會這麼喜歡萬聖夜啊？我還覺得這是個日本人難以融入的節日呢。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「真里亚为什么会这么喜欢万圣夜啊？我还觉得这是个日本人难以融入的节日呢。」
Indonesian (IDN): "I wonder why Maria likes Halloween so much. I thought that event was pretty difficult for Japanese people to get used to."
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Mi chiedo perché a Maria piaccia Halloween così tanto. Pensavo fosse un evento a cui è difficile abituarsi per i giapponesi."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Mi chiedo perché a Maria piaccia così tanto Halloween. Io credevo che fosse un evento difficile da comprendere per noi giapponesi."
Turkish (TR): "Maria'nın Cadılar Bayramını neden bu kadar çok sevdiğini merak ediyorum. Japonlar için bunun hep oldukça alışılmadık bir olay olduğunu düşünmüşümdür."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Steam (ST): "Well, it's a kid's festival where they get to parade around in costumes, right? It can be fun to play around in an outfit that's different than usual."
Umineko Project (UP): "Isn't that because it's a kid's festival where they get to parade around in costumes? It's fun to play around in an outfit that's different than usual."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Isn't that because it's a kid's festival where they get to parade around in costumes? It's fun to play around in an outfit that's different than usual."
PC Japanese (JP): 「仮装行列で練り歩く子どものお祭りだからじゃねぇのか？　普段と違う格好をしてはしゃぎあうってのは楽しいぜ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「仮装行列で練り歩く子どものお祭りだからじゃねぇのか？　普段と違う格好をしてはしゃぎあうってのは楽しいぜ」
Russian (RU): "Разве это не потому, что это маскарад для детей, где они могут наряжаться в костюмы? Ведь в костюмах играть гораздо веселее, чем обычно."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Não seria porque é um festival infantil onde podem desfilar por aí usando fantasias? Pode ser divertido sair brincando vestindo uma roupa diferente daquilo que você costuma vestir."
Vietnamese (VI): "Isn't that because it's a kid's festival where they get to parade around in costumes? It's fun to play around in an outfit that's different than usual."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「是不是因為，這是個小孩子們可以成群結隊地參加化裝游行的慶典啊？打扮成和平時不一樣的樣子玩鬧，可有意思嘞。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「是不是因为，这是个小孩子们可以成群结队地参加化装游行的庆典啊？打扮成和平时不一样的样子玩闹，可有意思嘞。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Isn't that because it's a kid's festival where they get to parade around in costumes? It's fun to play around in an outfit that's different than usual."
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Sarà perché è una festa per bambini dove tutti sfilano in costume? È divertente giocare con un aspetto diverso dal solito."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Forse è perché è una ricorrenza dove i bambini vanno in giro per strada in costume? È divertente darsi alla pazza gioia con un aspetto diverso dal solito."

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Steam (ST): "Hmm, ...I think there's a slightly deeper cause behind it. After all, she is the "witch" Maria-chan."
Umineko Project (UP): "No, ...I think there's probably a slightly deeper reason. After all, she is Maria‐chan "the witch"."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "No, ...I think there's probably a slightly deeper reason. After all, she is the 'witch' Maria-chan."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「うーん、…多分、僕はもう少しディープな理由によるものだと思うなぁ。何しろ、“魔女”の真里亞ちゃんだからね」

Vietnamese (VI): "No, ...I think there's probably a slightly deeper reason. After all, she is Maria‐chan "the witch"."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「嗯——，…我倒是觉得，这没准是更深层一点的原因造成的。毕竟，她可是“魔女”小真里亚啊。」
Indonesian (IDN): "No, ...I think there's probably a slightly deeper reason. After all, she is Maria‐chan "the witch"."
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "No... credo che ci sia probabilmente una ragione leggermente più profonda. Dopotutto, lei è la ‘strega’ Maria-chan."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Mmh... credo che sia per una ragione leggermente più complessa.{n}Dopotutto, lei è la ‘strega’ Maria-chan."
Turkish (TR): "Hmm, ...bunun arkasında biraz daha derin bir sebep olduğunu düşünüyorum. Sonuçta, o "cadı" olan Maria-chan."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "Come to think of it, when we were at the airport, didn't Maria say that if she was gonna wear a costume, it'd be a witch? Does she like witches?"
Umineko Project (UP): "Come to think of it, when we were at the airport, didn't Maria say that if she was going to wear a costume, it would be a witch? Does Maria like witches?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Steam (ST): "Uu-. ...To the Celts, the changing strength of the sun over the course of a year signified... its birth, its growing up period, its aging and death, and then its revival."
Umineko Project (UP): "Uu. ...The Celts thought of the changing strength of the sun over the course of a year...as its birth, its growing‐up period, its aging and death, and then its revival."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Steam (ST): "Yes. So, they thought that at the end of October, the sun died, was laid to rest in the land of the dead, and was then revived at the winter solstice. And the name they gave to the last day of their year, when the sun ended its one year lifespan and died...was Samhain, and they celebrated then."
Umineko Project (UP): "Yep. So they thought that at the end of October, the sun died, rested its body in the land of the dead, and then revived again at the winter solstice. And so, they celebrated the day that the sun ends its one‐year lifespan and dies, calling it New Year's Eve, or Samhain."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Yes. So they thought that at the end of October, the sun died, rested its body in the land of the dead, and then revived again at the winter solstice. Then, they called the day that the sun ended its one year lifespan and died New Year's Eve, or Samhain."
PC Japanese (JP): 「うん。だから彼らは、１０月の最後に太陽は死に、死の国で体を休めて、冬至の日に再び蘇ると考えたの。それで、太陽が一年の生涯を終えて死ぬその日を大晦日、サヴィンと呼んで、お祝いしたの。」

Russian (RU): "Да. Поэтому они считали, что в конце октября солнце умирает, его тело отправляется в земли мёртвых и затем возрождается снова во время зимнего солнцестояния. Поэтому они называют день, когда солнце завершает один год жизни и умирает, кануном нового года, или Самхайн."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Sim. Por isso eles acreditavam que no fim de outubro, o Sol morria, descansava seu corpo na terra dos mortos, e depois revivia novamente no solstício de inverno. E então, eles celebravam o dia que o Sol encerra seu ciclo de vida de um ano e morre, chamando‐o de Véspera de Ano‐Novo, ou Samhain."
Vietnamese (VI): "Yep. So they thought that at the end of October, the sun died, rested its body in the land of the dead, and then revived again at the winter solstice. And so, they celebrated the day that the sun ends its one‐year lifespan and dies, calling it New Year's Eve, or Samhain."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「嗯。所以他們認為，太陽會在十月底死去，接著在死之國修養完身體後，它又會在冬至那一天再度復甦。因此，他們就把太陽了卻一年的生命而死去的那一天，稱為了除夕日、{c:86EF9C:薩溫節}，並進行慶祝。{c:86EF9C:（詳見魔導書同名條目）}」

Indonesian (IDN): "Yep. So they thought that at the end of October, the sun died, rested its body in the land of the dead, and then revived again at the winter solstice. And so, they celebrated the day that the sun ends its one‐year lifespan and dies, calling it New Year's Eve, or Samhain."
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Sì. Perciò loro pensavano che alla fine di ottobre il sole morisse, riposasse il suo corpo nella terra dei morti e poi rivivesse ancora nel solstizio d'inverno. {n}Poi, chiamarono Vigilia di Capodanno, o Samhain, il giorno il cui sole terminava la sua annuale durata vitale e moriva."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Sì. Perciò ritenevano che alla fine di ottobre il sole morisse, e che il suo corpo riposasse nella terra dei morti per poi tornare in vita nel solstizio d'inverno.{n}E poi celebravano la fine dell'anno con il nome di Samhain, giorno in cui il sole pone fine al suo anno di vita e muore."

Böylece, güneşin bir yıllık ömrünü tamamlayıp öldüğü günü kutlayarak buna Yılbaşı Arifesi ya da Samhain demeye başladılar."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Steam (ST): "In the interval between October and November, life and death become the closest they ever will. ...The Celts believed that during this time, the world of the living grew closer to the world of the dead and otherworldly beings, and many of those living in the other world would come to visit.
Umineko Project (UP): "In the interval between October and November, life and death become the closest they ever will. ...The Celts believed that this was the time when the world of the living was at its closest to that of the dead and those not of this world, and when they would be visited by many inhabitants of the other world."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "In the interval between October and November, life and death become the closest they ever will. ...The Celts believed that during this time, the world of the living and the world where the dead and those not of this world reside grew closer, and many of those living in the other world would come to visit.
PC Japanese (JP): 「１０月と１１月の狭間は、生と死がもっとも近くなる。…ケルト人たちはこの時期に、生者の世界と、死者やこの世ならざる者の世界がもっとも近付き、異界の住人たちがたくさん訪れると信じてたの。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「１０月と１１月の狭間は、生と死がもっとも近くなる。…ケルト人たちはこの時期に、生者の世界と、死者やこの世ならざる者の世界がもっとも近付き、異界の住人たちがたくさん訪れると信じてたの」
Russian (RU): "В промежутке между октябрём и ноябрём, жизнь и смерть становятся как никогда близки друг к другу. ...Кельты верили, что в течение этого времени мир живых и загробный мир становятся ближе, и многие из тех, кто живёт в потустороннем мире, могут прийти."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "No intervalo entre outubro e novembro, vida e morte se tornam mais próximos do que nunca. ...Os Celtas acreditavam que este era o momento em que o mundo dos vivos estava mais próximo do mundo dos mortos e daqueles que não pertenciam a esse mundo, e que era o momento em que eles poderiam ser visitados por muitos habitantes do outro mundo."
Vietnamese (VI): "In the interval between October and November, life and death become the closest they ever will. ...The Celts believed that this was the time when the world of the living was at its closest to that of the dead and those not of this world, and when they would be visited by many inhabitants of the other world."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「十月和十一月的間隙，是生與死最為接近的時期。…凱爾特人相信，在這一時期裡，生者的世界最接近死者和非人者們的世界，異界的住民們將在此時大批到訪。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「十月和十一月的间隙，是生与死最为接近的时期。…凯尔特人相信，在这一时期里，生者的世界最接近死者和非人者们的世界，异界的住民们将在此时大批到访。」
Indonesian (IDN): "In the interval between October and November, life and death become the closest they ever will. ...The Celts believed that this was the time when the world of the living was at its closest to that of the dead and those not of this world, and when they would be visited by many inhabitants of the other world."
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Nell'intervallo tra ottobre e novembre, vita e morte diventano più vicini di quanto non lo siano mai stati. ... I Celti credevano che, durante quel periodo, il mondo dei vivi e quello dove risiedono i morti e coloro che non sono di questo mondo si avvicinassero, e che molti di quelli che vivono nell'altro mondo vengano a farci visita.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Steam (ST): "Uu-. Trick-or-treat is just for fun. It has nothing to do with what was originally a Celtic ceremony. That was created later when Christian customs were mixed in. ...However, I think it's right for Halloween to be that way."
Umineko Project (UP): "Uu. Trick or treat is just for fun. It has nothing to do with what was originally a Celtic ceremony. That was created later when Christian customs were mixed in. ...But I think that Halloween should be that way."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Uu-. Trick-or-treat is just for fun. It has nothing to do with what was originally a Celtic ceremony. That was created later when Christian customs were mixed in. ...However, Maria thinks that Halloween should be that way."

Russian (RU): "У‐у. 'Сладость или гадость' это просто для забавы. Это никак не связано с тем, что было изначально в кельтском ритуале. Это появилось позднее, когда вмешались христианские обычаи. ...Однако Мария считает, что Хэллоуин должен проходить именно так."

Vietnamese (VI): "Uu. Trick or treat is just for fun. It has nothing to do with what was originally a Celtic ceremony. That was created later when Christian customs were mixed in. ...But I think that Halloween should be that way."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「嗚——。“不給糖就搗蛋”就只是個遊戲。和原本凱爾特人的儀式沒有任何關係。它是後來與基督教的習慣混合之後的產物。…不過，真里亞倒是覺得，原本的萬聖夜就該是這樣。」

Indonesian (IDN): "Uu. Trick or treat is just for fun. It has nothing to do with what was originally a Celtic ceremony. That was created later when Christian customs were mixed in. ...But I think that Halloween should be that way."
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Uu-. Dolcetto o scherzetto è solo per divertimento. Non ha niente a che fare con quella che era originariamente la cerimonia Celtica. Fu creata dopo quando furono aggiunte le usanze Cristiane. ... Tuttavia, Maria pensa che Halloween dovrebbe essere così."

Steam (ST): According to Maria, the souls of the dead weren't the only ones who visited from the nonhuman world. There were also spirits with intimate connections to people's everyday lives.

PC Japanese (JP): 真里亞の話によると、人ならざる者たちの世から訪れるのは死者の霊ばかりでなく、人々の生活と密接な関係にある精霊たちもたくさん訪れるのだという。

Russian (RU): По словам Марии, души мёртвых были не единственными, кто являлся из потустороннего мира. Также имелись духи, которые были близки к быту людей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De acordo com Maria, as almas dos mortos não eram as únicas que visitavam do mundo dos não‐humanos; haviam também espíritos que tinham uma conexão íntima com os vivos.
Vietnamese (VI): According to Maria, the souls of the dead weren't the only ones who visited from the world of the nonhuman; there were also spirits that had an intimate connection to how people lived.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 據真里亞所言，從非人的世界來訪的不只是死者的靈魂，還有與人們的生活密切相關的大批精靈到訪。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 据真里亚所言，从非人的世界来访的不只是死者的灵魂，还有与人们的生活密切相关的大批精灵到访。
Indonesian (IDN): According to Maria, the souls of the dead weren't the only ones who visited from the world of the nonhuman; there were also spirits that had an intimate connection to how people lived.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Secondo Maria, le anime dei morti non erano l'unica cosa che proveniva dal mondo non umano. C'erano anche spiriti che avevano collegamenti diretti su come vivevano le persone.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Stando a quanto diceva Maria, dal mondo dei non umani non venivano solo le anime dei morti. Da esso provenivano anche spiriti che erano intrinsicamente connessi alle vite delle persone.
Turkish (TR): Maria'ya göre, insan olmayanların dünyasından ziyarete gelenler sadece ölülerin ruhları değildi; insanların nasıl yaşadıklarıyla yakından ilgilenen ruhlar da vardı.

Steam (ST): Humans could receive favors from those spirits, so they'd manage to gain magnificent blessings, as well as a year's worth of good crops.
Umineko Project (UP): It was because humans received the favors of those spirits that they were able to earn a wonderful blessing, and a year's worth of good crops.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Because humans could receive the favors of those spirits, they were able to earn a wonderful blessing, and a year's worth of good crops.
PC Japanese (JP): その精霊たちの恩恵を人間が受けられるからこそ、素晴らしい恵みを得ることができ、一年の収穫を得ることができたのだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): その精霊たちの恩恵を人間が受けられるからこそ、素晴らしい恵みを得ることができ、一年の収穫を得ることができたのだ。
Russian (RU): Так как люди могли заручиться благосклонностью тех духов, они могли получить их благословение и хороший урожай в течение года.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Isso porque humanos recebiam favores desses espíritos, capazes de obter até mesmo bênçãos maravilhosas, bem como um ano digno de boas safras.
Vietnamese (VI): It was because humans received the favors of those spirits that they were able to earn a wonderful blessing, and a year's worth of good crops.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 正是因為人類受到了這些精靈們的恩惠，才能得到上天的恩澤，獲得一年的收獲。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 正是因为人类受到了这些精灵们的恩惠，才能得到上天的恩泽，获得一年的收获。
Indonesian (IDN): It was because humans received the favors of those spirits that they were able to earn a wonderful blessing, and a year's worth of good crops.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dato che gli umani potevano ricevere i favori di quegli spiriti, erano capaci di ottenere una meravigliosa benedizione, e avere un anno ricco di raccolti.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Era proprio a causa dei favori che gli umani ricevevano da questi spiriti se potevano ricevere magnifiche benedizioni, così come un anno di buoni raccolti.
Turkish (TR): İnsanlar bu ruhların lütuflarını kabul etmeleri karşılığında olağanüstü bir berekete, ve bir yıl değerinde verimli hasada sahip olabiliyorlardı.

Russian (RU): Когда он заметил это, Баттлер сразу же вспомнил, что это было имя ведьмы с этого острова, но вред уже был причинён.

Vietnamese (VI): When he saw that, Battler immediately remembered that it was the name of the witch of this island, but the damage had been done.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 看到她這副樣子，戰人馬上就想起了那是這座島的魔女之名，但為時已晚。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 看到她这副样子，战人马上就想起了那是这座岛的魔女之名，但为时已晚。
Indonesian (IDN): When he saw that, Battler immediately remembered that it was the name of the witch of this island, but the damage had been done.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando se ne accorse Battler si ricordò immediatamente che era il nome della strega di quell'isola, ma il danno era già stato fatto.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Rendendosi conto di ciò, si ricordò subito che era il nome della strega di quell'isola, ma il danno era già bello che fatto...
Turkish (TR): Battler bunu gördüğünde, bunun bu adanın cadısının adı olduğunu anında hatırladı ama artık iş işten geçmişti.

Steam (ST): ...Until Maria's mood improved, she went on and on about many mysterious and fabulous episodes regarding the Golden Witch...
Umineko Project (UP): ...Until Maria's mood improved, many mysterious and fabulous episodes regarding the Golden Witch were drilled into his brain...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Until Maria's mood improved, she went on and on about many mysterious and fabulous episodes regarding the Golden Witch...
PC Japanese (JP): …真里亞が機嫌を直すまで、延々と黄金の魔女の素晴らしきミステリアスなエピソードの数々を語りこまれるのだった…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …真里亞が機嫌を直すまで、延々と黄金の魔女の素晴らしきミステリアスなエピソードの数々を語りこまれるのだった…。
Russian (RU): ...Пока настроение Марии не улучшилось, она прошлась по многим таинственным и невероятным эпизодам, касающимся Золотой Ведьмы...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Até o humor de Maria melhorar, muitos misteriosos e fabulosos episódios sobre à Bruxa Dourada foram escavados em seu cérebro...
Vietnamese (VI): ...Until Maria's mood improved, many mysterious and fabulous episodes regarding the Golden Witch were drilled into his brain...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …在真里亞心情好轉之前，他只好乖乖地聽她喋喋不休地講述了半天，黃金魔女精彩神秘的種種奇聞…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …在真里亚心情好转之前，他只好乖乖地听她喋喋不休地讲述了半天，黄金魔女精彩神秘的种种奇闻…。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Until Maria's mood improved, many mysterious and fabulous episodes regarding the Golden Witch were drilled into his brain...

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Maria si mise a narrare misteriosi e mirabolanti aneddoti riguardanti la Strega Dorata, fino a quando il suo temperamento non migliorò...
Turkish (TR): ...Maria'nın ruh hali düzelene kadar, Altın Cadı ile ilgili birçok gizemli ve masalsı olay beynine kazındı...

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa
Steam (ST): "That's enough, Maria. Thank you, Battler-kun, for letting her chat with you.
Umineko Project (UP): "That is enough, Maria. Thank you, Battler‐kun, for going along with her stories."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "That is enough, Maria. Thank you, Battler-kun, for going along with her story.
PC Japanese (JP): 「もうよしなさい、真里亞。ありがとうね戦人くん、お話に付き合ってくれて。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「もうよしなさい、真里亞。ありがとうね戦人くん、お話に付き合ってくれて」
Russian (RU): "Довольно этого, Мария. Спасибо тебе, Баттлер‐кун, что согласился послушать её историю."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Já chega, Maria. Obrigada, Battler‐kun, por deixar ela contar suas histórias."
Vietnamese (VI): "That is enough, Maria. Thank you, Battler‐kun, for going along with her stories."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「已經夠了！真里亞。戰人君，謝謝你陪她說話。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「已经够了！真里亚。战人君，谢谢你陪她说话。」
Indonesian (IDN): "That is enough, Maria. Thank you, Battler‐kun, for going along with her stories."
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Ora basta, Maria. Grazie, Battler-kun, per aver assecondato la sua storia.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Basta così, Maria. Grazie per aver ascoltato le sue storielle, Battler-kun..."
Turkish (TR): "Bu kadar yeter, Maria. Battler-kun, onun hikayelerine ayak uydurduğun için teşekkürler."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa
Steam (ST): ...Kanon-kun, don't you have work to do? Please leave now. Gohda-san, it looks like everyone wants to set down their bags for the time being. Sorry, but could you guide everyone to the guesthouse?"
Umineko Project (UP): "...Kanon‐kun, don't you have work to do? Please leave now. Gohda‐san, I think everyone wants to set down their bags for the time being. Sorry, but could you guide everyone to the guesthouse?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Kanon-kun, don't you have work to do? Please leave now. Gohda-san, it looks like everyone wants to set down their bags for the time being. Sorry, but could you guide everyone to the guesthouse?"
PC Japanese (JP): …嘉音くん、お仕事があるんでしょう？　もう行って頂戴。郷田さん、みんな取り敢えず荷物を置きたがってると思うの。悪いんだけど、みんなをゲストハウスへ案内してくれるかしら？」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…嘉音くん、お仕事があるんでしょう？　もう行って頂戴。郷田さん、みんな取り敢えず荷物を置きたがってると思うの。悪いんだけど、みんなをゲストハウスへ案内してくれるかしら？」
Russian (RU): "...Канон‐кун, ты сейчас ничем не занят? Пожалуйста, не задерживайся. Года‐сан, похоже, гости хотят избавиться от сумок. Извините, но не могли бы вы проводить всех до домика для гостей?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Kanon‐kun, você não tem trabalho a fazer? Por favor, vá agora. Gohda‐san, acho que todos gostariam de guardar suas malas agora. Desculpe, mas você poderia guiar todo mundo até a casa de hóspedes?"
Vietnamese (VI): "...Kanon‐kun, don't you have work to do? Please leave now. Gohda‐san, I think everyone wants to set down their bags for the time being. Sorry, but could you guide everyone to the guesthouse?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…嘉音君，你還有工作要做吧？請先走吧。鄉田，我覺得大家都很想先去把行李放好。不好意思，能請你帶大家去賓館嗎？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…嘉音君，你还有工作要做吧？请先走吧。乡田，我觉得大家都很想先去把行李放好。不好意思，能请你带大家去宾馆吗？」
Indonesian (IDN): "...Kanon‐kun, don't you have work to do? Please leave now. Gohda‐san, I think everyone wants to set down their bags for the time being. Sorry, but could you guide everyone to the guesthouse?"
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Kanon-kun, non hai lavoro da fare? Per favore, vai ora. Gohda-san, sembra che per il momento tutti vogliano poggiare i loro bagagli. Scusa, ma potresti portare tutti alla casa degli ospiti?"
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Kanon-kun, non hai delle mansioni da svolgere? Sarebbe ora che tu vada. Gouda‐san, credo che ora come ora tutti noi vorremmo posare i nostri bagagli. Scusami, ma potresti guidarci verso la dépendance?"
Turkish (TR): "...Kanon-kun, senin yapacak işin yok mu? Lütfen şimdi git. Gohda-san, sanırım herkes şimdilik valizlerini yerleştirmek istiyor. Kusura bakma ama herkese konukevine kadar rehberlik edebilir misin?"

Speaker: Gohda Toshiro
Steam (ST): "Certainly. ...Well then, everyone, allow me to guide you."
Umineko Project (UP): "Certainly. ...Well then, everyone, I will guide you to the guesthouse."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Certainly. ...Well then, everyone, I will guide you to the guesthouse."
PC Japanese (JP): 「かしこまりました。…それでは皆様、ゲストハウスへご案内いたします。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「かしこまりました。…それでは皆様、ゲストハウスへご案内いたします」
Russian (RU): "Разумеется. ...Что ж, господа, я отведу вас к домику для гостей."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Certamente. ...Muito bem, pessoal, eu lhes guiarei à casa de hóspedes."
Vietnamese (VI): "Certainly. ...Well then, everyone, I will guide you to the guesthouse."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「遵命。…那麼諸位，請隨鄙人去賓館。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「遵命。…那么诸位，请随鄙人去宾馆。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Certainly. ...Well then, everyone, I will guide you to the guesthouse."

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Come desidera... Bene, signore e signori, vi condurrò alla dépendance."
Turkish (TR): "Tabii ki. ...O zaman, herkese konukevine kadar rehberlik edeceğim."

Umineko Project (UP): "......Then if you will excuse me."

Steam (ST): They were eager to set down their luggage and take a breather, so they didn't realize that Rosa and Maria weren't coming with them.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 荷物を置いて、とりあえず一息つきたい彼らは、楼座と真里亞がその場に留まっていることには気付かなかった。
Russian (RU): Так как всем хотелось поскорей сбросить весь багаж и, наконец, отдохнуть, никто так и не понял, почему Роза и Мария остановились в этом месте.

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Visto che volevano sistemare i bagagli e riposarsi un po', non si accorsero che Rosa e Maria erano rimaste laggiù.

Steam (ST): ...There was a bright red mark there, making it clear how much excessive force she had been using on Maria's slender arm.
Umineko Project (UP): ...There was a bright red mark there, making it clear how much excessive force she had been gripping Maria's slender arm with.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...There was a bright red mark there, making it clear how much excessive force she had been gripping Maria's slender arm with.

Steam (ST): That hand then slapped against Maria's head, pinched her left ear, and lifted...
Umineko Project (UP): That hand then smacked Maria over the head, and pulled her left ear up into the air, pinching it sharply...

Umineko Project (UP): "I'm always telling you not to talk about witches...... ...Haven't I always said that was our promise together......?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Even though I'm always telling you not to talk about witches.........Haven't I always said that was our promise together......?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Steam (ST): "...Thank you. A Human can't do anything except dust it off, but a witch could restore it to how it once was. It would be easy for {f:5:Beatrice}. Kihihihihihi."
Umineko Project (UP): "...Thank you. A {y:0:Human}{n:0:human} can't do anything except dust it off, but a witch can repair it to how it was. It would be easy for {f:5:Beatrice}. Kihihihihihi."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...Thank you. A human can't do anything except dust it off, but a witch can repair it to how it was. It would be easy for Beatrice. Kihihihihihi."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…ありがとう。ニンゲンには埃しか払えないけど、魔女には元通りに直すことが出来るよ。ベアトリーチェなら簡単にね。きひひひひひ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…ありがとう。ニンゲンには埃しか払えないけど、魔女には元通りに直すことが出来るよ。ベアトリーチェなら簡単にね。きひひひひひ」
Russian (RU): "...Спасибо тебе. Человек не может сделать ничего, кроме как отряхнуть её, но ведьма сможет восстановить её так, как будто ничего не произошло. Для {f:5:Беатриче} это будет пустяковой задачей. Ки‐хи‐хи‐хи‐хи‐хи."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Obrigada. Um {y:0:Humano}{n:0:humano} não pode fazer nada exceto limpá‐lo, mas uma bruxa pode repará‐lo ao seu estado anterior. A {f:5:Beatrice} conseguiria sem dificuldade. Kihihihihihi."
Vietnamese (VI): "...Thank you. A {y:0:Human}{n:0:human} can't do anything except dust it off, but a witch can repair it to how it was. It would be easy for {f:5:Beatrice}. Kihihihihihi."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…謝謝。雖然人類只能做到擦掉灰塵，但魔女卻可以將它變回原樣哦。對貝阿朵莉切而言，輕而易舉。唧嘻嘻嘻嘻嘻。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…谢谢。虽然人类只能做到擦掉灰尘，但魔女却可以将它变回原样哦。对贝阿朵莉切而言，轻而易举。唧嘻嘻嘻嘻嘻。」
Indonesian (IDN): "...Thank you. A {y:0:Human}{n:0:human} can't do anything except dust it off, but a witch can repair it to how it was. It would be easy for {f:5:Beatrice}. Kihihihihihi."
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Grazie. Un umano non può fare nient'altro che togliere la polvere, ma una strega può farla tornare com'era. Sarà facile per Beatrice. Kihihihihihi."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Grazie. Un {y:0:Umano}{n:0:umano} può soltanto toglierci la polvere, ma una strega è capace di riportarlo al suo stato originale. Sarebbe una sciocchezza per {f:5:Beatrice}. Kihihihihihih."
Turkish (TR): "...Teşekkürler. Bir {y:0:İnsan}{n:0:insan} tozunu almaktan başka bir şey yapamaz ama bir cadı onu eski haline getirebilir. {f:5:Beatrice} için bu kolay olurdu. Kihihihihihi."

Steam (ST): Kanon felt a sharp pain inside his left hand, which was curled into a fist. ...In the past, a witch called {f:5:Beatrice} had appeared to tempt him and Shannon.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kyrie
Steam (ST): "But before that, perhaps we can spare the time to enjoy some black tea at our leisure, surrounded by the wonderful furnishings of the parlor..."

Russian (RU): "Вот только имеется ли у нас достаточно времени скрашивать досуг за чашкой чёрного чая в окружении такой прекрасной обстановки в гостиной..."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 楼座は真里亞の小さな胸に顔を埋めながら、涙を流して許しを乞う。
Russian (RU): Роза зарылась лицом в маленькую грудь Марии, плача и моля о прощении.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Rosa enterrou seu rosto no pequeno peito de Maria, chorando e implorando por perdão.
Vietnamese (VI): Rosa buried her face in Maria's small chest, crying and begging forgiveness.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 樓座把臉埋進真里亞小小的胸口裡，流著淚乞求原諒。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 楼座把脸埋进真里亚小小的胸口里，流着泪乞求原谅。
Indonesian (IDN): Rosa buried her face in Maria's small chest, crying and begging forgiveness.

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Rosa piangeva e implorava perdono, mentre affondava il viso sull'esile petto di Maria.
Turkish (TR): Rosa yüzünü Maria'nın küçük göğsüne gömdü, ağlıyor ve af diliyordu.

Steam (ST): ...And once again, those tears dripped down after who knows how many times.
Umineko Project (UP): ...And those tears dripped down again, as they had countless times before.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...And again those tears dripped down after who knows how many times.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …そして、これが何度目になるかわからない涙を、再び零させた。
Russian (RU): ...И её слезы капали вновь и вновь, бог знает в какой уже раз.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...E mais uma vez, aquelas lágrimas escorreram, assim como haviam escorrido incontáveis vezes antes.
Vietnamese (VI): ...And those tears dripped down again, as they had countless times before.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …然後她再一次地灑落了，事到如今已數不清是第幾次灑落的淚水。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …然后她再一次地洒落了，事到如今已数不清是第几次洒落的泪水。
Indonesian (IDN): ...And those tears dripped down again, as they had countless times before.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... E di nuovo quelle lacrime caddero giù dopo chissà quante volte.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Dopodiché, pianse ancora e ancora, perdendo il conto di quante lacrime avesse versato.
Turkish (TR): ...Ve o gözyaşları daha önce sayısız kez olduğu gibi yine aşağıya süzüldü.

Steam (ST): If only the brilliant sun had been shining on the two of them, all of their cares would have evaporated, and it might've felt like they could begin anew.
Umineko Project (UP): If only the brilliant sun had been shining on the two of them, all of their cares would have evaporated, and they would have felt like they could begin anew.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If only the brilliant sun had been shining on the two of them, all of their cares would have evaporated, and they would have felt like they could begin anew.
PC Japanese (JP): せめて二人を、燦々とした太陽が照らしていたなら、二人のわだかまりが全て解け、これからのやり直しを感じさせたかもしれない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): せめて二人を、燦々とした太陽が照らしていたなら、二人のわだかまりが全て解け、これからのやり直しを感じさせたかもしれない。
Russian (RU): Если бы только над ними воссияло солнце, то все бы их заботы испарились бы без следа, и они бы почувствовали, что могут начать всё сначала.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se apenas o brilhante sol estivesse brilhando sobre elas, todas as suas preocupações teriam evaporado, e elas teriam sentido que poderiam começar de novo.
Vietnamese (VI): If only the brilliant sun had been shining on the two of them, all of their cares would have evaporated, and they would have felt like they could begin anew.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 如果她們兩人能至少是處在燦爛的陽光照耀之下，那這一幕說不定還能讓人感到，兩人之間的芥蒂全部化解，將會重歸於好。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 如果她们两人能至少是处在灿烂的阳光照耀之下，那这一幕说不定还能让人感到，两人之间的芥蒂全部化解，将会重归于好。
Indonesian (IDN): If only the brilliant sun had been shining on the two of them, all of their cares would have evaporated, and they would have felt like they could begin anew.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Se solo la luce accecante del sole avesse brillato su di loro, tutte le loro preoccupazioni sarebbero scomparse, e si sarebbero sentite capaci di cominciare una nuova vita.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Se il sole avesse potuto almeno far risplendere il suo bagliore su di loro, tutte le loro preoccupazioni sarebbero svanite, e avrebbero potuto sentirsi in grado di ricominciare daccapo...
Turkish (TR): Eğer parlak güneş ikisinin üzerinde parıldıyor olsaydı, tüm kaygıları buharlaşacak ve her şeye yeniden başlayabileceklerini hissedebileceklerdi.

Steam (ST): ...However, what surrounded the two of them was the worsening weather. Sadly, there were only fierce winds with occasional thunder.
Umineko Project (UP): ...However, what surrounded the two of them was the worsening weather.{n}The strong winds mixed in with the sound of thunder were saddening.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...However, what surrounded the two of them was the worsening weather. The strong winds mixed in with the sound of thunder were saddening.
PC Japanese (JP): …しかし、今の二人を包むのは崩れ行く天気。雷鳴の混じる強い風であることが悲しかった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …しかし、今の二人を包むのは崩れ行く天気。{n}雷鳴の混じる強い風であることが悲しかった。
Russian (RU): ...Однако их окружала лишь всё ухудшающаяся погода.{n}Сильный ветер, вперемешку с печальными раскатами грома.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Entretanto, o que as cercava era o clima que se agravava.{n}Os fortes ventos misturados com os ocasionais trovões eram entristecentes.
Vietnamese (VI): ...However, what surrounded the two of them was the worsening weather.{n}The strong winds mixed in with the sound of thunder were saddening.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …可是，現在包圍著她們兩人的卻是越來越壞的天氣。{n}強風凌厲，雷鳴陣陣，實在讓人嘆息。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …可是，现在包围着她们两人的却是越来越坏的天气。{n}强风凌厉，雷鸣阵阵，实在让人叹息。
Indonesian (IDN): ...However, what surrounded the two of them was the worsening weather.{n}The strong winds mixed in with the sound of thunder were saddening.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Tuttavia, ciò che le circondava era il maltempo che peggiorava. I forti venti si mischiavano fra loro mentre il suono dei tuoni rattristava l'ambiente.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Ma a circondarle adesso c'era il tempo che stava degenerando.{n}Il forte vento, unito ai rombi di tuono, rendeva tale scena alquanto triste.
Turkish (TR): ...Ancak, ikisini çevreleyen şey gittikçe kötüleşen gökyüzüydü.{n}Gök gürültüsüyle karışan şiddetli rüzgârlar üzüntü vericiydi.

Steam (ST): The sound of Maria sniffling brought Rosa to her senses. ...If Maria stood exposed to the wind for too long, she'd probably catch a cold.
Umineko Project (UP): Rosa noticed the sound of Maria sniffling.{n}...If she stood exposed to the wind for too long, she would probably catch a cold.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The sound of Maria sniffling made Rosa notice....If she stood exposed to the wind for too long, she would probably catch a cold.
PC Japanese (JP): 真里亞が鼻をすする音に気付く。…いつまでも風に晒されていたら風邪を引いてしまうだろう。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 真里亞が鼻をすする音に気付く。{n}…いつまでも風に晒されていたら風邪を引いてしまうだろう。
Russian (RU): Сопение Марии послужили сигналом для Розы.{n}...Если она будет так долго стоять на ветру, то обязательно простудится.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A fungação de Maria fez com que Rosa voltasse a si.{n}...Se elas ficassem exposta ao vento por tempo demais, provavelmente acabariam pegando um resfriado.
Vietnamese (VI): Rosa noticed the sound of Maria sniffling.{n}...If she stood exposed to the wind for too long, she would probably catch a cold.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 樓座注意到了真里亞抽鼻子的聲音。{n}…老待在這風裡，是會得感冒的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 楼座注意到了真里亚抽鼻子的声音。{n}…老待在这风里，是会得感冒的。
Indonesian (IDN): Rosa noticed the sound of Maria sniffling.{n}...If she stood exposed to the wind for too long, she would probably catch a cold.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il suono di Maria che tirava su col naso fece pensare Rosa. ... Se è rimasta al freddo per troppo tempo, sicuramente si è presa un raffreddore.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Rosa sentì che Maria stava tirando su con il naso...{n}Se fosse rimasta esposta al vento per troppo tempo, avrebbe potuto prendersi un raffreddore.
Turkish (TR): Rosa, Maria'nın burnunu çekerken çıkardığı sesi fark etti.{n}...Eğer uzun süre rüzgara maruz kalırsa, muhtemelen üşütecekti.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa
Steam (ST): "...Okay, Maria, it's almost time for lunch. Why don't you come back to the mansion with me?"
Umineko Project (UP): "......So, Maria. It will be lunch very soon. Come back to the mansion with Mama."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......So, Maria. It will be lunch very soon. Why don't you come back to the mansion with Mama."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……さ、真里亞。もうすぐお昼よ。ママと一緒にお屋敷に行きましょう。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……さ、真里亞。もうすぐお昼よ。ママと一緒にお屋敷に行きましょう」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Vamos, Maria. Logo será hora do almoço. Vamos voltar à mansão com a mamãe."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……来，真里亚。马上就到中午了。和妈妈一起去大屋吧。」

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Allora, Maria. È quasi ora di pranzo. Perché non vieni alla villa con la mamma?"
Turkish (TR): "......Hadi, Maria. Çok yakında öğle yemeği hazır olacak. Annenle malikaneye gel."

Steam (ST): Rosa thought she'd already received Maria's forgiveness, so she hadn't imagined Maria would refuse.
Umineko Project (UP): Rosa thought that Maria had already forgiven her, so she never imagined she would refuse.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Rosa thought that she had already received Maria's forgiveness, so she hadn't imagined Maria would refuse.
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座は、もう真里亞に許しを得られたと思ったから、まさか断られると思わなかった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 楼座は、もう真里亞に許しを得られたと思ったから、まさか断られると思わなかった。
Russian (RU): Роза думала, что уже заслужила прощение Марии, поэтому не могла представить, что Мария может отказаться.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Rosa pensou que Maria já havia perdoado ela, por isso nunca imaginou que Maria recusaria algo.
Vietnamese (VI): Rosa thought that Maria had already forgiven her, so she never imagined she would refuse.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 樓座以為自己已經得到了真里亞的原諒，所以她根本沒想到，自己竟會遭到拒絕。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 楼座以为自己已经得到了真里亚的原谅，所以她根本没想到，自己竟会遭到拒绝。
Indonesian (IDN): Rosa thought that Maria had already forgiven her, so she never imagined she would refuse.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Rosa pensò di aver già ricevuto il perdono di Maria, perciò non si sarebbe immaginata un rifiuto da parte della bambina.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Rosa credeva di aver già ricevuto il perdono di Maria, per cui non credeva che Maria avrebbe mai detto di no.
Turkish (TR): Rosa, Maria'nın kendisini çoktan affettiğini düşünüyordu, bu yüzden reddedeceğini hiç düşünmemişti.

Steam (ST): But that expression on Maria's face didn't look like that of a child resisting her mother. ...So Rosa couldn't understand why Maria wanted to stand still, pointlessly, as the weather grew even worse.
Umineko Project (UP): But that expression on Maria's face didn't look like that of a child resisting her mother. ...So Rosa wasn't able to understand why Maria wanted to stand still in the rose garden, pointlessly, as the weather grew even worse.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But that expression on Maria's face didn't look like that of a child resisting her mother. ...So Rosa wasn't able to understand why Maria wanted to stand still, pointlessly, as the weather grew even worse.
PC Japanese (JP): でもその表情には、母親に反抗したいという様子は見られない。…だから楼座は、どうして真里亞が天気の崩れつつある薔薇庭園に、意味もなく立ち尽くしていたいのか理解できなかった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): でもその表情には、母親に反抗したいという様子は見られない。…だから楼座は、どうして真里亞が天気の崩れつつある薔薇庭園に、意味もなく立ち尽くしていたいのか理解できなかった。
Russian (RU): Но выражение на лице Марии не походило на лицо ребёнка, сопротивляющегося своей матери. ...Поэтому Роза не могла сообразить, почему Мария решила остаться на месте, ведь это нелепо при всё ухудшающейся погоде.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas aquela expressão no rosto de Maria não parecia a de uma criança resistindo à sua mãe. ...Rosa não foi capaz de entender o porquê de Maria querer ficar parada no jardim de rosas, sem sentido, enquanto o tempo ficava cada vez pior.
Vietnamese (VI): But that expression on Maria's face didn't look like that of a child resisting her mother. ...So Rosa wasn't able to understand why Maria wanted to stand still in the rose garden, pointlessly, as the weather grew even worse.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過真里亞的表情，也看不出是想要反抗母親的樣子。…所以樓座想不出，為什麼真里亞會想在這越變越壞的天氣中，毫無意義地站在玫瑰庭園裡。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过真里亚的表情，也看不出是想要反抗母亲的样子。…所以楼座想不出，为什么真里亚会想在这越变越坏的天气中，毫无意义地站在玫瑰庭园里。
Indonesian (IDN): But that expression on Maria's face didn't look like that of a child resisting her mother. ...So Rosa wasn't able to understand why Maria wanted to stand still in the rose garden, pointlessly, as the weather grew even worse.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ma quell'espressione sul volto di Maria non sembrava quella di un bambino che disobbedisce alla Madre. ... Perciò Rosa non riuscì a capire come mai Maria volesse stare ancora lì, inutilmente, mentre il tempo peggiorava ulteriormente.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Ma dalla sua faccia, non sembrava volesse disobbedire a sua madre... Pertanto, Rosa non riusciva a capire perché, con il tempo che stava peggiorando, Maria volesse rimanere nel roseto.
Turkish (TR): Ama Maria'nın yüzündeki ifade, annesine direnen bir çocuğunkine benzemiyordu. ...Bu yüzden Rosa, Maria'nın hava daha da kötüleşirken neden gül bahçesinde anlamsızca durmak istediğini anlayamadı.

Steam (ST): ...They'd only just managed to make up, after all. She chose her words carefully, trying to get Maria to come with her to the mansion without denying the witch outright.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...After they had just gone to great lengths to make up with each other. She chose her words carefully, trying to get Maria to come with her to the mansion without denying the witch outright.
PC Japanese (JP): …せっかく仲直りしたばかり。魔女を頭ごなしに否定できず、どう言えば真里亞が自分と一緒に屋敷へ来てくれるか言葉を選んだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …せっかく仲直りしたばかり。{n}魔女を頭ごなしに否定できず、どう言えば真里亞が自分と一緒に屋敷へ来てくれるか言葉を選んだ。
Russian (RU): ...И это после того, через что им пришлось пройти, чтобы найти взаимопонимание.{n}Она осторожно подбирала слова, пытаясь убедить Марию пойти с ней в особняк, без прямого отрицания ведьм.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Elas mal haviam conseguido fazer as pazes.{n}Ela escolheu suas palavras cuidadosamente, tentando fazer Maria voltar com ela à mansão sem negar a bruxa de imediato.

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "*cackle*cackle*! Indeed, a witch can use curses to make people catch colds, ...but how foolish would it be if she caught one herself? From now on, you should take care not to catch something like a cold yourself."

Russian (RU): "*Хихи*хихи*! Ведьмы могут проклятьем наслать на людей простуду, но было бы глупо, если бы они сами её подхватили. Теперь тебе нужно постараться и не простудиться."

Vietnamese (VI): "*cackle*cackle*! Witches make people catch colds with curses, but how foolish would it be if they caught one themselves. You should focus your energies on ensuring that you do not catch a cold yourself."

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "Indeed, <Happy Halloween>. Hoh, is this for me? How truly adorable, that a candy would be made out of this, the lonely light of a man lost in the darkness of Purgatory, unable to go to heaven or hell."
Umineko Project (UP): "Mm, Happy Halloween. Hoh, for me, you say? Even the single and only light given to a man lost in the darkness of purgatory, unable to go to heaven or hell, looks truly charming when made into a candy like this."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Hmm, Happy Halloween. Hoh, for me? How truly lovely that this unique light, of a man lost in the darkness of purgatory, unable to go to heaven or hell, would be made into a candy like this."
PC Japanese (JP): 「うむ、ハッピーハロウィン。ほぅ、これを妾にとな？　天国にも地獄にも行けず、煉獄の闇にて彷徨う男の唯一の灯りも、こうして菓子となれば実に可愛らしいことよ。」

Vietnamese (VI): "Mm, Happy Halloween. Hoh, for me, you say? Even the single and only light given to a man lost in the darkness of purgatory, unable to go to heaven or hell, looks truly charming when made into a candy like this."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「嗯，萬聖夜快樂。喔，這個是給妾身的嗎？上不了天國下不了地獄，彷徨於漆黑煉獄裡的{c:86EF9C:那男人的唯一明燈}，像這樣變成糖果後也真是挺可愛的呢。{c:86EF9C:（詳見魔導書“童話傳說相關”條目）}」

PC Japanese (JP): 魔女は、真里亞が握り締めているお菓子に気付く。…それは楼座が踏みつけて惨めな姿になった、真里亞のお菓子。

Steam (ST): "Because it really was that wonderful a candy. The candy of your memories is always full and fluffy. So you try to remember as well. What kind of candy was it really{p:0:♪}"
Umineko Project (UP): "Because it really was that wonderful a candy. The candies in our memories are always full and fluffy. So you too must close your eyes and try to remember. What kind of candy was it really{p:0:♪}"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Because it really was that wonderful a candy. The candy of your memories is always full and fluffy. So you too, close your eyes and try to remember. What kind of candy was it really♪"
PC Japanese (JP): 「本当はあんなにも素敵なお菓子だったから。思い出の中のお菓子はいっつもふっくら。だからあなたも思い出してごらんなさい。本当はどんなお菓子だったのか♪」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「本当はあんなにも素敵なお菓子だったから。思い出の中のお菓子はいっつもふっくら。だからあなたも思い出してごらんなさい。本当はどんなお菓子だったのか♪」
Russian (RU): "Какая это была чудесная конфета. Сладости в твоих воспоминаниях всегда яркие и красивые. Поэтому ты тоже закрой глаза и попытайся вспомнить. Какой эта конфета была на самом деле{p:0:♪}"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Porque ele era realmente um doce maravilhoso. Os doces em nossas memórias são sempre fofos e macios. Por isso, você deve fechar seus olhos e imaginá‐lo. Que tipo de doce ele realmente era{p:0:♪}"
Vietnamese (VI): "Because it really was that wonderful a candy. The candies in our memories are always full and fluffy. So you too must close your eyes and try to remember. What kind of candy was it really{p:0:♪}"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「因為它原本是那麼美妙的糖果果。在記憶中的糖也總是軟綿綿。所以你也來好好想一想。它原本是什麼樣的糖呀♪」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「因为它原本是那么美妙的糖果果。在记忆中的糖也总是软绵绵。所以你也来好好想一想。它原本是什么样的糖呀♪」
Indonesian (IDN): "Because it really was that wonderful a candy. The candies in our memories are always full and fluffy. So you too must close your eyes and try to remember. What kind of candy was it really{p:0:♪}"
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Perché era davvero un dolce meraviglioso. Il dolce dei tuoi ricordi è sempre pieno e morbido. Dunque anche tu, chiudi gli occhi e cerca di ricordare. {n}Che tipo di dolce era in realtà {p:0:♪}"
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Era un dolcetto davvero meraviglioso. Nei tuoi ricordi rimarrà per sempre tenero e polposo. Perciò, cerca anche tu di ricordare. Qual è la sua forma da ricreare?{p:0:♪}"
Turkish (TR): "Çünkü gerçekten o kadar harika bir şekerdi. Anılarımızdaki şekerler her zaman dolgun ve yumuşacıktır. Bu yüzden gözlerini kapatmalı ve hatırlamaya çalışmalısın. Gerçekte nasıl bir şekerdi{p:0:♪}"

Steam (ST): ...Along with those strange words, spoken as though singing an improvised folk song, the witch threw the sweet into the air.
Umineko Project (UP): ...Along with those strange words, spoken as though singing an improvised folk song, the witch threw the sweet into the air.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Along with those strange words, spoken as though singing an improvised folk song, the witch threw the sweet into the air.
PC Japanese (JP): …即興の民謡のような、歌うように語る不思議な言葉と共に、魔女はお菓子を宙に放る。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …即興の民謡のような、歌うように語る不思議な言葉と共に、魔女はお菓子を宙に放る。
Russian (RU): ...Вместе с этими странными словами, словно напевая импровизированную народную песню, ведьма подбросила конфету в воздух.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Junto com aquelas palavras estranhas, faladas como se cantasse uma canção folclórica improvisada, a bruxa atirou o doce no ar.
Vietnamese (VI): ...Along with those strange words, spoken as though singing an improvised folk song, the witch threw the sweet into the air.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …伴隨著這有如即興的民謠，又宛如歌唱一般道出的不可思議的言語，魔女把糖果扔向了天空。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …伴随着这有如即兴的民谣，又宛如歌唱一般道出的不可思议的言语，魔女把糖果扔向了天空。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Along with those strange words, spoken as though singing an improvised folk song, the witch threw the sweet into the air.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Con quelle strane parole, pronunciate come se stesse cantando una canzone popolare inventata sul momento, la strega lanciò il dolce nell'aria.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): ...Come pronunciò quelle strane parole, intonate come se stesse cantando una filastrocca improvvisata, la strega lanciò il dolce in aria.
Turkish (TR): ...Cadı, doğaçlama bir halk şarkısı söyler gibi söylediği bu tuhaf sözlerle birlikte şekeri havaya fırlattı.

Steam (ST): Maria was closing her eyes and remembering, just as the witch had told her to. ...What shape had that crushed candy really had?
Umineko Project (UP): Maria had her eyes closed, just as the witch had told her, and was focused on remembering.{n}...The shape that the crushed candy had really been.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Maria was closing her eyes and remembering, just as the witch had told her....What shape had that crushed candy really had?
PC Japanese (JP): 真里亞は魔女に言われた通り、目を閉じて思い出していた。…潰れたお菓子が、本当はどんな姿をしていたか。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 真里亞は魔女に言われた通り、目を閉じて思い出していた。{n}…潰れたお菓子が、本当はどんな姿をしていたか。
Russian (RU): Мария закрыла глаза и вспомнила сказанные ведьмой слова.{n}...Какая на самом деле была форма у раздавленной конфеты?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Maria estava com seus olhos fechados, assim como a bruxa havia dito a ela, focada em lembrar.{n}...O formato que o doce esmagado realmente tinha.
Vietnamese (VI): Maria had her eyes closed, just as the witch had told her, and was focused on remembering.{n}...The shape that the crushed candy had really been.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 真里亞照著魔女說的，閉起眼睛回想了起來。{n}…回想起了那被踩爛了的糖果，原本是什麼樣子。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 真里亚照着魔女说的，闭起眼睛回想了起来。{n}…回想起了那被踩烂了的糖果，原本是什么样子。
Indonesian (IDN): Maria had her eyes closed, just as the witch had told her, and was focused on remembering.{n}...The shape that the crushed candy had really been.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Maria teneva gli occhi chiusi e ricordava, proprio come le aveva detto la strega. Che forma aveva in realtà quel dolce schiacciato?
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Maria chiuse gli occhi per ricordare, proprio come le aveva detto la strega...{n}Qual era la vera forma di quel dolcetto schiacciato?
Turkish (TR): Maria, cadının ona söylediği gibi gözlerini kapatmış ve hatırlamaya odaklanmıştı.{n}...Ezilmiş şekerin gerçekte sahip olduğu şekli.

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Pertanto, fu solo Rosa a vedere quella scena.

Steam (ST): Unable to comprehend what was occurring right before her eyes, Rosa stood with her mouth hanging open, completely forgetting to shut it...
Umineko Project (UP): Unable to understand the event that was occurring right in front of her eyes, Rosa stood with her mouth open, forgetting to shut it...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Unable to understand the event that was occurring right in front of her eyes, Rosa stood with her mouth open, forgetting to shut it...

Steam (ST): ...There could be no mistake. It was one of Kinzo's special envelopes, used when he wrote with his own hand and bearing the Ushiromiya family crest.

Steam (ST): It was sealed with red sealing wax, ...and furthermore, it had a mark that seemed to have been made by the Head's Ring.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): つまり、この中に何が書いてあるかを問わず、…真里亞がベアトリーチェと呼ぶこの女は、右代宮家現当主の親書を預かれるほどの信用を得ているということになる…！

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em outras palavras, independente do que estava escrito dentro dele, ...esta mulher, quem Maria chamava de {f:5:Beatrice}, era confiada o suficiente a ponto de estar encarregada de uma carta pessoal do atual chefe da família Ushiromiya...!

Chinese Simplified (CN): 也就是说，先不管里面的信上写着什么，…总之，这位被真里亚叫作贝阿朵莉切的女人，受信赖到了能保管右代宫家现任当主写的亲笔书信…！

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "It could have been any of the four siblings. However, the fact that I have met you here probably means that you were chosen by Kinzo's roulette.
Umineko Project (UP): "It could have been any of the four siblings. However, the fact that I have met you here probably means that you were chosen by Kinzo's roulette."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "It could have been any of the four siblings. However, the fact that I have met you here probably means that you were chosen by Kinzo's roulette.
PC Japanese (JP): 「四兄弟の誰でも良かった。だが、ここでそなたと出会ったということは、金蔵のルーレットがそなたを選んだということなのだろう。

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「其實給四兄妹中的誰都行。不過，妾身在此與汝相遇，也就代表著金藏的輪盤賭選中了汝吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「其实给四兄妹中的谁都行。不过，妾身在此与汝相遇，也就代表着金藏的轮盘赌选中了汝吧。」

Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...In that case, take it. Then read its contents aloud while seated at the dinner table, when all of the siblings are gathered."

Steam (ST): Today was the family conference, and the biggest object of discussion would be the inheritance problem. ...So, she had joined together with Eva and Rudolf, and they planned to force a certain condition on Krauss to try and extort several hundred million yen in cash out of him.
Umineko Project (UP): Today was the family conference, and the biggest object of discussion was the inheritance problem. ......So, she had joined together with Eva and Rudolf, and they had planned to force certain conditions upon Krauss to try to extort a prompt payment of several hundred million yen out of him.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Today was the family conference, and the biggest object of discussion was the inheritance problem. ......So, she had joined together with Eva and Rudolf, and they had planned to force a certain condition on Krauss to try and extort several hundred million yen in cash out of him.
PC Japanese (JP): 今日は親族会議で、その最大の議題は遺産問題。……そして、彼女は、絵羽、留弗夫の二人と組んで、蔵臼にある条件を突きつけ、何億円かの即金を支払うよう強要する計画だった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 今日は親族会議で、その最大の議題は遺産問題。……そして、彼女は、絵羽、留弗夫の二人と組んで、蔵臼にある条件を突きつけ、何億円かの即金を支払うよう強要する計画だった。
Russian (RU): Сегодня было собрание семьи, и важнейшим объектом обсуждения в ней стала проблема с наследством. ......Поэтому она объединилась с Евой и Рудольфом, чтобы поставить Крауссу некоторые условия и истребовать с него пару сотен миллионов йен.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Hoje era a conferência familiar, e o maior objeto de discussão era o problema da herança. ......Por isso, ela havia se juntado a Eva e Rudolf, que haviam planejado forçar certas condições sobre Krauss para tentar extorquir um pagamento imediato de diversas centenas de milhões de ienes dele.
Vietnamese (VI): Today was the family conference, and the biggest object of discussion was the inheritance problem. ......So, she had joined together with Eva and Rudolf, and they had planned to force certain conditions upon Krauss to try to extort a prompt payment of several hundred million yen out of him.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在今天親族會議上，最大的議題是遺產問題。……而且按計劃，她本是要和繪羽、留弗夫兩人聯合起來，向藏臼提出某個條件，逼迫他現付幾億日元現金的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在今天亲族会议上，最大的议题是遗产问题。……而且按计划，她本是要和绘羽、留弗夫两人联合起来，向藏臼提出某个条件，逼迫他现付几亿日元现金的。
Indonesian (IDN): Today was the family conference, and the biggest object of discussion was the inheritance problem. ......So, she had joined together with Eva and Rudolf, and they had planned to force certain conditions upon Krauss to try to extort a prompt payment of several hundred million yen out of him.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Oggi aveva luogo la conferenza di famiglia, e il maggior argomento di discussione era il problema dell'eredità. ... Per questo, lei si era unita ad Eva e Rudolf, e insieme avevano pianificato di imporre a Krauss una certa condizione per potergli estorcere diverse centinaia di milioni di yen in contanti.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Oggi c'era la riunione di famiglia, e il problema dell'eredità sarebbe stato il più grande tema di discussione... E lei si era unita ad Eva e a Rudolf, pianificando di imporre delle condizioni a Klaus per estorcergli diverse centinaia di milioni di yen in contanti.
Turkish (TR): Bugün aile konferansı vardı ve en büyük tartışma konusu miras sorunuydu. ......Bu yüzden Eva ve Rudolf'la bir araya gelmiş, ve Krauss'a bazı şartlar dayatarak ondan birkaç yüz milyon yenlik acil bir ödeme koparmaya çalışmayı planlamışlardı.

Steam (ST): It was as if the witch could see through all of that. ...What does she intend to announce...when all of us siblings are gathered?
Umineko Project (UP): It was as if the witch could see through all of that.{n}......And when all of the siblings are gathered, ....what is she planning on announcing to us?

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Era come se la strega sapesse già tutto ciò. ... E cosa ha intenzione di annunciarci quando tutti i fratelli saranno riuniti?
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Era come se la strega potesse vedere attraverso tutto questo...{n}E poi, cos'era che aveva intenzione di annunciare quando si sarebbero radunati tutti i fratelli e le sorelle?

Steam (ST): The witch probably laughed because she knew Kinzo's own doctor had announced that Kinzo didn't have long to live.
Umineko Project (UP): The witch's laugh was probably because she knew that Kinzo's own doctor had told him that he would not live much longer.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The witch probably laughed because she knew that Kinzo's own doctor had announced that his remaining life was slim.
PC Japanese (JP): 魔女のその笑いは、金蔵が主治医に余命わずかと宣告されていることを知った上でなのだろう。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 魔女のその笑いは、金蔵が主治医に余命わずかと宣告されていることを知った上でなのだろう。

Steam (ST): ...However, if anyone actually looked at Kinzo and noticed his vigor, which wasn't at all what you'd expect from someone nearing the end of his life, they might easily call that "doing extremely well".
Umineko Project (UP): ...However, if anyone actually looked at Kinzo, his energy and vigor, which made it extremely difficult to imagine that his remaining life really was slim, might make it natural to call him "full of life".
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...However, if anyone actually looked at Kinzo, his will power, which made it extremely difficult to imagine that his remaining life really was slim, might make it seem natural to call him healthy.
PC Japanese (JP): …もっとも、実際の金蔵を見れば、余命わずかとは到底思えないその気力に、元気であると例えたとしても何の不思議もないかもしれない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …もっとも、実際の金蔵を見れば、余命わずかとは到底思えないその気力に、元気であると例えたとしても何の不思議もないかもしれない。
Russian (RU): ...Однако если бы кто‐нибудь посмотрел на Кинзо, то его сила воли заставила бы кого угодно усомниться в том, что отпущенный ему срок невелик, поэтому казалось, что он и впрямь очень здоров.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Entretanto, se qualquer um olhasse para Kinzo, perceberia sua energia e vigor, que faziam com que fosse extremamente difícil imaginar que sua vida restante era de fato curta; era possível até afirmar que ele estava "cheio de vida".
Vietnamese (VI): ...However, if anyone actually looked at Kinzo, his energy and vigor, which made it extremely difficult to imagine that his remaining life really was slim, might make it natural to call him "full of life".
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …當然了，若是親眼見到了金藏，那麼也許把他那副怎麼想都不像是命不久矣的氣魄，比作“非常精神”，也就沒什麼好奇怪的了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …当然了，若是亲眼见到了金藏，那么也许把他那副怎么想都不像是命不久矣的气魄，比作“非常精神”，也就没什么好奇怪的了。
Indonesian (IDN): ...However, if anyone actually looked at Kinzo, his energy and vigor, which made it extremely difficult to imagine that his remaining life really was slim, might make it natural to call him "full of life".
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Tuttavia, guardando Kinzo, la sua forza di volontà, che rendeva difficile immaginare che gli restasse così poco da vivere, avrebbe potuto dare l'idea che fosse in salute.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Tuttavia, se qualcuno avesse osservato Kinzo con i suoi occhi, il quale aveva un vigore che non era affatto quello che ci si aspetterebbe mai da uno vicino alla fine della sua vita, non avrebbe avuto problemi a definirlo come ‘in salute’...
Turkish (TR): ...Ancak, eğer biri gerçekten Kinzo'ya bakarsa, kalan ömrünün gerçekten az olduğunu düşünmeyi son derece zorlaştıran enerjisi ve dinçliği nedeniyle ona "hayat dolu" denmesini doğal karşılayabilirdi.

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "Then let us go and greet him. I look forward to hurling curses at each other after 30 years."

Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Then let us greet him. It will be good to hurl curses at each other after thirty years."

Steam (ST): As the witch grinned, she started walking, leaving Genji behind. ...Her gait was like that of a family member who knew the inside of the mansion well.

Steam (ST): A guest for Kinzo had arrived, despite him being almost dead, on the day of the family conference when the fate of the inheritance was to be decided. ...And furthermore, this person was familiar enough with the Ushiromiya Family household that Genji was following behind her.
Umineko Project (UP): There was a visitor for Kinzo, whose remaining life was not long, on the day of the family conference when the fate of the inheritance was to be decided, ...and furthermore, this person was well enough acquainted with the Ushiromiya family that Genji was following behind her.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Havia uma visita para Kinzo, cuja vida restante não era longa, no dia da conferência familiar, quando o destino da herança estava para ser decidido,{n}...e mais do que isso, esta pessoa era intimamente familiarizada com a casa da família Ushiromiya, a ponto de ser Genji quem a estava seguindo.

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 金藏的餘命已不長，在這要討論如何處置他遺產的親族會議這一天，居然來了客人，…而且這個人物，還是能讓源次跟在身後伺候的右代宮家的熟人。

Original Witch Hunt (OG): From this exchange, Kyrie realized that she was a guest of fairly high rank, even amidst the Ushiromiya family.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kyrie
Steam (ST): "...Pleased to meet you. I'm Kyrie. I wonder if this is our first meeting. If we have met before, I apologize for forgetting your name."
Umineko Project (UP): "......Pleased to meet you. My name is Kyrie. I wonder if this is our first meeting. If we did greet each other before, I apologize for forgetting your name."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Pleased to meet you. I am Kyrie. I wonder it this is our first meeting. If we did greet each other before, I apologize for forgetting your name."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……初めまして。霧江と申します。初対面でしょうか。もし以前に挨拶をしていたなら、名前を忘れてしまって申し訳ございません。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……初めまして。霧江と申します。初対面でしょうか。もし以前に挨拶をしていたなら、名前を忘れてしまって申し訳ございません」

Vietnamese (VI): "......Pleased to meet you. My name is Kyrie. I wonder if this is our first meeting. If we did greet each other before, I apologize for forgetting your name."

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Piacere di conoscerla. Il mio nome è Kyrie. Mi domando se questo sia il nostro primo incontro. Se ci siamo presentate in precedenza, mi scuso per aver dimenticato il suo nome."

Turkish (TR): "......Tanıştığıma memnun oldum. Ben Kyrie. Acaba bu ilk karşılaşmamız mı? Eğer daha önce tanıştıysak, isminizi unuttuğum için bağışlayın."

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "...So, you intend to force me to state my name, even though you already have a vague idea of the answer?"

Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...Even though you have a vague idea, you dare to ask my name?"

Vietnamese (VI): "...You already have a vague idea, yet you expect me to waste my breath?"

Indonesian (IDN): "...You already have a vague idea, yet you expect me to waste my breath?"

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Quindi intende dire che le debba dare il mio nome, nonostante lei abbia già una vaga idea della risposta?"
